Class Photograph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Photograph

  • public class Photograph
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Photograph. It draws the image to the position of (50,50). It allows the user to change and get the colors of pixels and upload a new image and get that image.
    Version:
    3.0 on 5/23
    Author:
    Mira Shlimenzon, Sarah Sabaa (image upload and scaling)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int margin 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Photograph(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
      Initializes a Photograph with a certain image and a 2D grid array for Pixels in the photograph.

      Gets the pixel at the pixel location of(x,y)

      Gets the width of the image
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.image.ImageObserver io)
      Paints the image onto the DrawingSurface at coordinates (50,50) with either the image's real width and height or a scaled version of the image
      void setColor(int x, int y, java.awt.Color c)
      Sets a new Color at the pixel location(x,y) in the grid
      void setImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
      Sets a new image for the Photograph, sets width and height, and creates 2D grid of Pixels with the image's width and height
      void setsColorForPixels()
      Fills the 2D Array of Pixels with pixels of their designated color

    • Field Detail

      • margin

        public final int margin
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Photograph

        public Photograph(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Initializes a Photograph with a certain image and a 2D grid array for Pixels in the photograph. If image chosen is null, then the 2D Pixel grid is null. Sets width and height. If image is too big, will scale the image down.
        Parameters:
        img - BufferedImage that makes up the Photograph

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  java.awt.image.ImageObserver io)
        Paints the image onto the DrawingSurface at coordinates (50,50) with either the image's real width and height or a scaled version of the image
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object to draw with
        io - ImageObserver

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the image
        Returns:
        width Width of the image

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the image
        Returns:
        height Height of the image

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Sets a new image for the Photograph, sets width and height, and creates 2D grid of Pixels with the image's width and height
        Parameters:
        img - BufferedImage that will be the new image

      • setsColorForPixels

        public void setsColorForPixels()
        Fills the 2D Array of Pixels with pixels of their designated color

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Gets the image being used as the Photograph
        Returns:
        image the BufferedImage being used to draw Photograph

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor(int x,
                               int y)
        Gets the color at the pixel location(x,y) in the grid
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate of pixel location
        y - Y-coordinate of pixel location
        Returns:
        Color color of the pixel at the location (x,y)

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int x,
                     int y,
                     java.awt.Color c)
        Sets a new Color at the pixel location(x,y) in the grid
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate of pixel location
        y - Y-coordinate of pixel location
        c - New color to be sent at this location
